title: #1 Most Tilting Thing in League
body: Beating up your lane opponent and then watching them be a cannon minion while their team beats your 4v5 and they walk away with LP.

replies.body: The most tilting thing as a support main is when my team doesn't let me use my {{item:3097}}  charges.  I'm sitting there auto attacking a cannon minion that is at half health about to execute it and the middle laner spends mana to use their Q to take it from me.  I can understand if you crit it with an auto attack or use an aoe ability that kills it but when it is the only minion left and you spend mana to use an ability specifically to kill that one minion it just makes me want to walk under the enemy tower.

To be honest, I don't trust Thresh players with this item when they want to use a stack. Cauz they usually suck at last hitting. If it were any other support that uses this item, I would let them take minions.

Thresh counts as a ranged champion, so relic shield is not supposed to work. For some reason, if I last hit as thresh with enough damage to kill it (without execute from RS) then it will still proc the gold share effect sometimes. Coin is definitely a better build for him imo.
The stacks do work. It's the execution passive that doesn't work with him since he is a ranged champ.
{{champion:16}} I'm on it

As much as I hate recommending this, I have found it to be effective if you blow your flash and/or ult to express your frustration, and you make sure to let them know why you did it.

Most of the time they're not willfully denying it, they just forget that relic shield exists. Knowing that you're going to blow summs and potentially throw the game makes them suddenly care a lot more about whether you get those stacks.

I only do this if they steal the cannon (or other minions homestly) when there's no enemies around, because I get just wanting to waveclear and get out when they're under pressure.

But it seems you don't get pushing waves fast in the mid to lategame to create pressure instead of waiting 20 seconds for thresh or any other low dmg user to clear the wave when i can instapop it as swain/ori/ahri/syndra

Worse: crushing lane oppoent, then watching as they either 

A) Splitpush endlessly, forcing you to spend the majority of the game countering their push.
B) Have picked a champion that is still threatening or useful when 0/10, so the fact they got crushed doesn't really effect them to much.

A: If the opponent plays a skirmisher, then that's the best strategy when he is behind. That's basically all he can do. Just because you stomped your opponent doesn't mean that he'll be utterly useless.
B: Unless the champion is a tank, I call bs.
0/10 Yasuo with 2 crit items :^)
Darius hits a sizeable power spike after a 2nd item even if he's decently behind.  Same with Fiora, Trynd, Yasuo, Jax and Kled.
But they hit that power spike later if they miss a lot of cs due to deaths.

For B, that can happen with champions that scale, or champions that provide valuable utility even if they're not a tank. That's just the nature of a MOBA. Being 0/10 shouldn't be a sentence to uselessness for the entire rest of the match in League unless they're an early-game champion and failed with their early strength.
0/50 Fizz with any item...

We get 1 good engage mid that forces them to let Jax be for 2 minutes or so, he takes two towers, 

Jax gets two items, can suddenly 1V1 4/5ths of their team, and survive vs. the lane opponent that has been crushing him all match.
Winning top lane sometimes is more tilting than losing it. This is why I left for other roles

"gg ez"

When youre 2 whole items ahead of your lane opponent, make a nice play that wipes the enemy team, you recall at low hp with the other 4 enemies dead, your team full health and ready to take objectives...

...wait nevermind, they're diving your lane opponent. One by one. Enemy quadra kill.
The most tilting thing in league is when you're fed with 22/0 as an off-meta pick and your team surrenders for no reason.

One of the top tilting things is when Riot has an OBVIOUSLY OP/Broken champion but doesn't do anything to fix them for 6+ months and you end up facing them half the time since your team doesn't feel the need to ban them.
Better ban Yasuo.

Minute 5: teammate dominates on a carry, goes 5-0 tons of CS, other lanes doing fine as well

Minute 15: doesn't use their lead in the slightest advantageous way. Keeps diving for kills, goes 8-0, CS slipping a little

Minute 22: Continues to dive, a few 2 for 1s, 1for1s, doesn't understand they are feeding the enemy team. Rest of team holding the map, takes towers and inhib while fed carry is fighting

Minute 40: should have ended 10 mins ago. Teams more even now. Fed carry still playing like it's 10mins in when they had a full item advantage on everyone. Overextends attempting to randomly kill enemy's support.

Minute 41: enemy takes baron. Takes Nexus. All teammates of fed carry stunned, hate life.
Top lane

The most tilting thing I find, is crushing your lane opponent, but it just so happens to be X champion that builds one or two items, gets a power spike and becomes a snowball hypercarry when 0/5-6-7-8.

Shouldn't be allowed to happen. No. You lose lane hard, you play catch up. You do not get two items, when everyone else has 3 or 4, and then two shot the carries, building full tank until victory.

When you're beating a hard counter mid, but bottom has fed the enemy jungler assassin.
He can now come to your lane and press one button and you die, and the people that fed him say "don't feed"

When you play any game mode with bronze friends and matchmaking  puts you against high plats. Can't have fun if the game is completely one-sided. Even in flex queue got put into games against high plats with me being the bronze and other 2 buddies being silver.

Beating your lane opponent and getting outscaled at minute 15+

That is the most tilting thing for me. BALANCE
I hate having a close 2v2 trade and either lose or they get away then i press tab and see my support didnt bother to use exhaust :)
Completely carrying and then getting an A+

Watching a feeding fizz being able to one shot your adc. This happened to me yesterday or the day before and our ezreal got hit by a smallish fish from fizz and he got 1 shot with the full combo. The fizz was feeding pretty hard and I had done well against him in lane. The fizz also had only 1 item. It was kinda demoralizing.

It also happened today. The fizz who was 1/9 with a zhonyas and lich was able to 1v1 the zed who had 2 and a half items I believe and he had a hexdrinker. Man I hate that champion...
When you learn to play a champ.  And then some intern at Riot decides nope, that champ is toxic, and then reworks them into oblivion.  LOL #TILTED.

My main problem with "Reworks" or as I call them Hemroids is that I have spent ALOT of money on my account, mostly on skins for champions I love to play. All of a sudden the champion I bought the skins for doesn't exist any more and I'm left feeling almost resentful and more than once very angry.

I feel like its not what I paid for, wish there could be some kind of trade for an equal value skin if you purchased the original skin with rp at least.

It's pretty tilting when somebody allows a {{champion:45}} to farm uncontested for 20+ minutes then you check his AP to see it's over 1300+. You wonder where his lane "opponent" is only to find out they are too busy stealing jungle minions from your jungler...

Might as well start planning for 4vs5 matches, because he's going to delete one of you regardless of your mag def.

I think this is more tilting:
I'm a mid mage against a mid assassin.  I kill them twice and am outfarming them ~70 to ~20 CS.  After the second kill, they don't return to lane.  I ping missing.  I double ping missing.  I give bot the *caution* exclamation point.  20 seconds later the enemy mid shows up bot and gets a double kill, beginning the snowball.

*Mid why didn't you follow?*
Oh I don't know, maybe because I'm:
1. Not sure the enemy is going bot.  He could be going top.
2. Not as mobile.
3. Pushing mid lane to increase my exp and CS advantage over the enemy while potentially taking mid turret.

How about when I ping that enemy Talon is missing, you ward up and play passively?
When your auto fill "support" plays an ap champ, doesn't know what vision is, feeds all game, and blames you
oh so people still abusing the autofill support to get lower queue time and then pick another champ? D:
